ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is an overview of different approaches regarding the politics of language. There was one class focused on theory and the rest were about case studies of various language situations around the world.I would recommend this class only if you are very interested in the social and political aspects of language use.

if you're an anthropology major and are looking to fulfill your language distribution requirement.... don't take this class. take himalayan languages with turin or something else. the readings for the class are all really interesting but errington is a terrible seminar leader and class was often painfully boring. linguistic anthropology is really interesting and i found the theories and material interesting, but the discussion really fell flat.
Good course for understanding sociology and politics of language
